head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Cocaine Dealer Sentenced

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Cocaine Dealer Sentenced

body.head.byline: By Julia Preston (NYT); Compiled by John Sullivan

block.p: A Colombian narcotics trafficker who pleaded guilty in February 2003 to shipping cocaine to New York City was sentenced in Manhattan Federal Court yesterday to 19 years and 7 months in prison and ordered to forfeit $25 million. The trafficker, Fernando Henao Montoya, a member of the Norte del Valle cartel, collected millions of dollars in New York from a 5,000-kilogram cocaine shipment delivered in early 1999, federal prosecutors said. A brother, Arcangel Henao Montoya, has been charged with cocaine smuggling and is in federal custody in Brooklyn.
